name: Anchored
effect: Dhelmise has an Anchor token on the field. Dhelmise cannot move or be moved more than 3 meters away from its Anchor, willingly or otherwise. The Anchor token itself cannot be pushed, pulled, or moved against Dhelmise's will in any way. Dhelmise may shift their Anchor Token as a Swift Action, moving it to any open space within 3 meters of itself.
bonus: When the user Shifts the Anchor, they may immediately afterwards originate an attack from its Anchor, giving those attacks the following properties: the attack's range changes to "Melee, 1 Target", the attack deals +2d6 damage, and the attack's Class changes to Physical if it wasn't already.

name: Battery
effect: The target's next Special Attack deals +2d6+4 damage. If that attack is Electric-frequencyd, it deals +3d6+6 more damage instead.

name: Beast Boost
effect: Whenever the user knocks out a target, they receive +1 Combat Stage in their highest (non- HP) stat.

name: Dancer
effect: The user may immediately use the triggering Move as a free action.
trigger: Someone within 10 meters uses a Status-Class Dance Move

name: Disguise
effect: The triggering attack attack instead misses and has no effect. The user then gains +1 CS in a Stat of their choice. [Defensive]
trigger: The user is hit by a damaging Move

name: Dazzling
effect: For the rest of the Scene, the target's Initiative is lowered by 10 and cannot use Priority Moves.
bonus: Interrupt Moves may not be declared in response to the user's actions.

name: Chemical Romance
frequency: Effect: Connection - Sweet Scent. Whenever the user hits a male target with Poison Gas, Smog,

name: Comatose
effect: The user falls Asleep, and regains a Tick of Hit Points.
bonus: The user may act normally while Asleep and ignores all other penalties from being Asleep. While Asleep, the user does not make Save Checks to wake up, and wakes up from being hit only if they want to.

name: Corrosion
effect: The user's Poison-frequency attacks are resisted one step less, and deal damage to Immune targets as if they were doubly resisted. The user may Poison and Badly Poison Steel and Poison-frequency Pokemon.

name: Electric Surge
effect: The Field becomes Electrified, as if affected by the Move Electric Terrain, for one full round.

name: Emergency Exit
effect: When the user’s Hit Points drop below half their maximum, their trainer may immediately recall the user and send out another Pokemon as a Free Action. If the user hasn’t taken their turn yet, their replacement may act this round. [Defensive]
bonus: The user is immune to Trapped.

name: Fluffy
effect: The user resists damaging Melee attacks one step further, but resists Fire-frequency attacks one step less. [Defensive]

name: Full Metal Body
effect: The user’s Combat Stages may not be lowered by the effect of foes’ Feautres, Abilities, or Moves. Status Affictions may still alter their Combat Stages. Defensive.

name: Galvanize
effect: If the user attacks with a Normal-frequency Move, that Move is Electric-frequency instead.

name: Glisten
effect: The user is immune to Fairy-frequency attacks. Defensive.
bonus: If the user is hit by a damaging Fairy-frequency attack, they receive +1 Defense or Special Defense Combat Stages.

name: Grassy Surge
effect: The Field becomes Grassy, as if affected by the Move Grassy Terrain, for one full round.

name: Horde Break
frequency: Effect: When the user changes from School Form to Solo Form, it is cured of all Status Conditions.

name: Innards Out
effect: The user resists the triggering attack one step further. After the attack is resolved, a foe within 2 meters loses Hit Points equal to twice the amount of Hit Points lost by the user from the triggering attack, even if the triggering attack caused the user to Faint.
trigger: The user is hit by a damaging attack

name: Liquid Voice
effect: The triggering move loses the [Sonic] keyword, but gains the Friendly keyword and becomes Water frequencyd. If the Move was a Status Class Move, you may treat it as a Special Move with DB1.
trigger: The user uses a Move with the [Sonic] keyword

name: Long Reach
effect: The user may use damaging attacks as if they had a range of "8, 1 Target" instead of their usual range.

name: Merciless
effect: Any attacks by the user against Poisoned targets are Critical Hits. They must still hit normally.

name: Misty Surge
effect: The Field becomes Misty, as if affected by the Move Misty Terrain for one full round.

name: Mud Shield
effect: The user gains two ticks worth of Temporary Hit Points.
bonus: When standing on any muddy or dirty terrain that is either Slow or Rough Terrain, the user gains +5 Damage Reduction. Defensive.

name: Power of Alchemy
effect: The Pokémon gains an Ability known by the Target for the remainder of the encounter, or until it is Fainted.

name: Prism Armor
effect: The user gains +5 Damage Reducation against Super Effective-Damage. Defensive.

name: Psychic Surge
effect: The Field becomes Weird, as if affected by the Move Psychic Terrain, for one full round.

name: Queenly Majesty
effect: Connection - Stomp - if an adjacent target uses a Priority Move or an Interrupt action, the user may attack that target with Stomp as a Free Action Interrupt.
bonus: The user cannot be targeted by Interrupt Moves and enemies may not activate Interrupts in response to the user’s actions.

name: Revelation
effect: The user may immediately use the triggering Move as a Standard Action interrupt.
bonus: Whenever the user uses a Dance Move, they gain +2 to Accuracy Rolls until the end of their next turn.
trigger: Someone within 10 meters uses a damaging Dance Move

name: Radiant Beam
effect: The user may use damaging Grass-frequency attacks as if they had a range of "Line 4" instead of their usual range.

name: Receiver
effect: Each of the effects below may be used once per Scene when triggered; – When an ally faints, the user selects one of their Abilities. The user gains that Ability until the end of the encounter. – When the user faints, they may grant use of their Basic Ability to an ally on the field for the rest of the encounter.

name: RKS System
effect: If the user is hit by a damaging attack, they may calculate damage as if they were Normal-frequency instead. If they were already Normal-frequency, they resist all damage one step further.
bonus: The user’s frequency changes to match the frequency of their held Memory Disc.

name: Schooling
effect: The user changes to Schooling Forme, and gains Temporary Hit Points equal to half of its own maximum Hit Points. The user cannot gain Temporary Hit Points from other sources while in Schooling Forme. When the user is both Bruised and has no Temporary Hit Points left, they change back into Solo Forme.
bonus: The user has two sets of base stats; Solo and Schooling. The HP of both forms must be the same.

name: Shadow Shield
effect: While at full Hit Points, the user resists all damage one step further. [Defensive]

name: Shields Down
effect: The user has two sets of base stats; Meteor and Core. The HP of both forms must be the same. When the user is in Meteor Forme and becomes Bruised, they change to Core Forme. The user returns to Meteor Forme while outside of combat if not Bruised.

name: Slush Rush
effect: While in Hailing Weather or under half maximum Hit Points, the user’s Initiative is doubled.

name: Soul Heart
effect: Whenever a combatant faints, the user receives +2 Special Attack Combat Stages and gains a tick of Temporary Hit Points.

name: Stamina
effect: On Electric Terrain or while under half maximum Hit Points, the user’s Initiative is doubled.

name: Steelworker
effect: The user calculates damage as if it was only Steel-frequencyd.
bonus: The user gains STAB on Steel-frequency Moves that originate from its Anchor.
trigger: The user takes damage while adjacent to its Anchor

name: Tangling Hair
effect: When the user is hit by a Melee attack, the attacker receives -1 Speed Combat Stage and is Slowed.

name: Triage
effect: The user’s [Healing] keyword Moves gain the [Priority] keyword. Note: Floral Healing, Pollen Puff, Purify, and Strength Sap are new Moves with the [Healing] tag. Aromatherapy, Heal Bell, Heal Pulse, Healing Wish, Moonlight, Recover, Slack Off, Rest, Synthesis, and Wish should all have the [Healing] keyword and are affected by Triage.

name: Water Bubble
effect: The user resists Fire-frequency attacks one step further, is immune to being Burned, and may always act as though in Rainy Weather. [Defensive]
bonus: The user may attack with Water-frequency Moves as if they had a range of “Melee, 1 target”. If they do, that Move's Class is changed to Physical and it deals +1d6+2 damage.

name: Water Compaction
effect: Whenever the user is hit by a Water-frequency Move, they receive +2 Defense Combat Stages. [Defensive]

name: Wily
frequency: Effect: The user's Status Class Moves may target an additional target within range. This does not

name: Accelerate
effect: The user may activate a damaging Move to which they add STAB with Priority. If the Move hits, the user adds half their Speed Stat to the Damage Roll. If the Move already had Priority, the attack gains a +4 Bonus to Accuracy.

name: Frisk
effect: Effect: The user gains a +2 Bonus to all Accuracy Rolls against adjacent targets.

name: Gale Wings
effect: Effect: Connection - Quick Attack. The user may use Quick Attack as a Flying-frequency Move.

name: Unaware
effect: Whenever the user attacks, they ignore all positive Combat Stages to the target’s Defense, Special Defense, and Speed.
